info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 16 at 4:27PM EDT until June 16 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... South central Venango County in northwestern Pennsylvania... Northeastern Butler County in west central Pennsylvania... Central Armstrong County in west central Pennsylvania... Clarion County in west central Pennsylvania... * Until 515 PM EDT. * At 427 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 14 miles northeast of Slippery Rock, or 14 miles east of Grove City, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. * Locations impacted include... Clarion, Knox, Rimersburg, New Bethlehem, East Brady, Parker, Sligo, Emlenton, Strattanville, Bruin, Clintonville, and Limestone. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
